metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3412 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The sfc (aka Solarflare Solarstorm) driver in the Linux kernel before 3.2.30 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (DMA descriptor consumption and network-controller outage) via crafted TCP packets that trigger a small MSS value. Ben Hutchings reported a flaw in the Linux kernel with some network drivers that support TSO (TCP segment offload). A local or peer user could exploit this flaw to to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
